Package model.placementArea

Class PlacementAreaTest

java.lang.Object
junit.framework.Assert
junit.framework.TestCase
model.placementArea.PlacementAreaTest
All Implemented Interfaces:
junit.framework.Test
public class PlacementAreaTest extends junit.framework.TestCase
This class is used to test the functionality of the PlacementArea class. It extends the TestCase class from the JUnit framework.

  • Constructor Details

    • PlacementAreaTest

      public PlacementAreaTest()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public static void initialize(PlacementArea area, ArrayList<Integer> cardList, ArrayList<Coordinates> coord, boolean face, Deck[] deckList)
      This method initializes the game state, inserts the cards expressed from CLI in the placement area of the player. The starter card will be automatically added.
      Parameters:
      area - The PlacementArea where the cards will be placed.
      cardList - The list of cards to be placed.
      coord - The coordinates where the cards will be placed.
      face - The face orientation of the cards.
      deckList - The list of decks from which the cards will be drawn.

    • putCards

      public static void putCards(ArrayList<Integer> cards, ArrayList<Coordinates> coordList, boolean face, PlacementArea area, Deck[] deckList) throws RuntimeException
      This method places cards in the placement area.
      Parameters:
      cards - The list of cards to be placed.
      coordList - The coordinates where the cards will be placed.
      face - The face orientation of the cards.
      area - The PlacementArea where the cards will be placed.
      deckList - The list of decks from which the cards will be drawn.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the size of the coordinate list does not match the size of the card list.

    • checkForObjectives

      public static int checkForObjectives(PlacementArea area, ObjectiveCard obj)
      This method checks for objectives in a given area.
      Parameters:
      area - The PlacementArea where the objectives are to be checked.
      obj - The ObjectiveCard that contains the objectives to be checked.
      Returns:
      The number of points counted from the objectives.

    • testObjectiveCounts

      @Test public void testObjectiveCounts() throws Exception
      This method tests the counts of various objectives. It sets up various scenarios and checks if the count of points matches the expected results.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the test.

    • runTest

      public void runTest(int[] cards, int[] coordinates, int[] objectives, int[] expectedResults, boolean face)
      This method runs a test for a given set of cards, coordinates, objectives, and expected results. It initializes a PlacementArea, places the cards at the given coordinates, and checks if the count of points from the objectives matches the expected results.
      Parameters:
      cards - An array of card IDs to be placed in the PlacementArea.
      coordinates - An array of coordinates where the cards are to be placed.
      objectives - An array of objective IDs to be checked.
      expectedResults - An array of expected results for each objective.
      face - A boolean value indicating whether the cards are face up or face down.
